alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 12 at 2:36PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 235 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Rain is ending but significant run off will cause small stream and creek flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hodgdon, Sherman, Island Falls, Amity, Haynesville, Reed Plantation, Cary Plantation, Linneus, Cary, Orient, Glenwood, Forkstown, North Amity, Monarda, Silver Ridge and Benedicta. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
